body:
Does this fix this?

```
Loading mod: d2k
Game started
Stacktrace:

  at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) object.__icall_wrapper_mono_gc_alloc_vector (intptr,intptr,intptr) <IL 0x0000f, 0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper alloc) object.AllocVector (intptr,intptr) <IL 0x00088, 0xffffffff>

  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.PathFinder.MakePath (OpenRA.Mods.Common.Pathfinder.IGraph`1<OpenRA.Mods.Common.Pathfinder.CellInfo>,OpenRA.CPos) [0x00011] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/World/PathFinder.cs:207
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.PathFinder.FindPath (OpenRA.Mods.Common.Pathfinder.IPathSearch) [0x0004d] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/World/PathFinder.cs:130
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Pathfinder.PathFinderCacheDecorator.FindPath (OpenRA.Mods.Common.Pathfinder.IPathSearch) [0x00040] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Pathfinder/PathFinderCacheDecorator.cs:78

    mono() [0x4b3f7c]
```

@obrakmann  Yeah, it definitely should, that's the same error I ran into. Looking at the stack trace the error happens when the harvester wants to deliver the resources and then tries to find a refinery, but all of them are crowded (3 or more harvesters per ref). This then generates an infinite loop in the makePath function of the pathfinder.

My changes allow that in the unfortunate case all refs are crowded, then it will take one of them nonetheless.

gave it a shot , it felt different at the start (harvesters took different paths , but that might be imagination) .... but ended up as usually ... ( didnt test the crash-fix) 

![test harvs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/6548116/bc3ebbb8-c5ee-11e4-84e1-dd76caae5685.png)
My changes do not solve the blocking. Just saying.

@MicroJOo: The harvester jams are a separate issue that can be dealt with separately.  Lets deal with these problems one step at a time.  This looks like a sensible change, but I haven't tested it yet.
Rydra : yes ... but @Mailaender thinks that ... -> #3089

I solved the issue #3089 in this PR. It was due to the custom cost associated to harvesters and the way the pathfinder manages a crowded situation.

It's a damn, hideous hack that needs to be ripped from this world, but for now it should suffice.

Just tested this and found a problem: Any harvester with resources that fails to path back due to refineries being oversubscribed will remain idle from then on.

Previous to the pathfinding changes, once a harvester vacated the refinery then one of the idle harvesters with resources would path back to it.

However even the old code had an issue: If you moved the harvesters that were currently en route to the refinery somewhere else, the idle harvs with resources will keep sitting there.

To reproduce: Build a single refinery and spam 6-12 harvs.

@RoosterDragon problem solved. It was an issue with cache. I could see that if there are no available refineries, there is a wait time of 1 second, inferior to the 2 seconds span of the pathcache. Everytime you access a value in the cache, the ticks are refreshed back. That made the harvesters loop into an infinite zero-path calculation and stay there forever unless you explicitly move them.

Please fetch and reset again and try please.

amazing ... the harvester block seems to be fixed now ... what a relief ! thank you @Rydra !!! 

---

still , i have to be a litte bit cheeky again ... and point out , that the originally purposed "somewhat" fix for the harvesters intelligence (gather nearer resources)  isnt really visible ingame ... 
the grey line here , indicates the path that my harvester is driving to collect the next ressources : 

![harvester heuristic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/6588576/f3518bf2-c793-11e4-8831-eaa94afa7dbb.png)

---

also , theres one particular "dumb" thing ... that harvester still do .. when theres atleast 2 harvester heading in the direction of the harvester-unloading-patch ... sometimes first one that arrives will immediately make a turn without unloading the ore  , give the second harvester priority and line up behind him ... im sure when you watch a couple harvesters gathering ressources , youll notice this in every game 
but its probably a different issue

@MicroJOo the new heuristic makes them "somewhat" more intelligent, that doesn't mean though they are :). The heuristic now considers the distance between the search point where you clicked and the nearest resource that there is in that position, so that now goes first for the nearest resource that it finds in the point you clicked (previously it was quite "random"). But yeah the heuristic needs still some work and to be revisited.

The priority thing in harvesters is something that already happened in the past. That corresponds to another area. As I've said harvesters' code needs a refactor. Once it's done probably we'll be able to detect where the problem originates.

Also are we still working on the assumption this will fix #7630? Reading each side it seems the check preventing int.MaxValue leaking out here should indeed resolve that issue, but I just wanted that confirmed since I haven't tested for that.

@RoosterDragon amended commit comment as requested :).

I haven't been able to reproduce the error again, but it should be solved. Looking at the stack trace, that situation can only happen if pathfinder returns a point which has a cost of int.Maxvalue. And that situation could happen in a crowded situation as I could see.

Now that I introduced the checking in the pathfinder in this PR, it should not happen anymore.

Anyway, that "int.Maxvalue" is quite hideous and evil. I'd rather use int? values.

@RoosterDragon : it happens in "every" game though ... im playing ra on this engine since 3-4 years now , and let me tell you ... in a balanced game , with good players ... this has quite some impact

anyway , im quite happy now about the fixed blocking ...(and so will +50 other regular players probably)
@MicroJOo: That's fair. Maybe we should have that as a separate issue if this is merged since getting the blocking fixed would be more important.

OK, this looks good ingame. I had 3 refineries and 30 harvesters and there was absolutely no blockage.
I'd merge this as it is, but I want to clear something up first.
Imagine you have 1 refinery and 10 harvesters. You send all harvesters to harvest simultaneously. First 3 finished will "reserve" the 3 refinery "slots" (refineries seem to allow only 3 reservations). The rest, when full, will sit idle at the resource field while the first of those 3 unloads. Then one of the idle harvesters will go to the refinery to wait in line, while the rest continue to sit at the resource field.
This can be very bad if you are harvesting a resource field that is far from your base, near enemy territory, or especially when playing D2k.

P.S.: I just realized that the "no more blockage at the refinery" is actually a result of "no more than 3 harvesters may approach the refinery at a time", which IMO fixes an annoyance, but introduces an even bigger problem.
I'd like to see full harvesters with no refinery at which to unload to move ... maybe behind the closest refinery? That way:
1. They won't sit in the middle of nowhere, waiting to be picked off by enemy scouts/raiding parties/worms.
2. They won't block the harvester that is currently unloading.

@penev92 what you mention about harvs far in d2k and staying there idle... Did it work previously or it worked like this PR is doing right now?

If this PR makes harvs work like before, I'd leave this PR as is and work on a new PR that does what you want.

Just tested bleed. Seems like harvesters try to bunch up around the refinery when they are full, regardless of how many they are (which of course  causes the blockage).
This is a different kind of broken than with this PR.
And I'd say that is the lesser evil, since at least they sit idle in your base, not on the battlefield.
Sorry :/

@penev92 up to this point we can just come up with two approaches, as I don't feel confident enough with implementing that "behind ref" harvester (that is code that is outside my initial scope of pathfinder and personal interest).

We can either change the custom cost so that no harvs are left in the sand but blockages may happen, or leave them as they are right now.
Change the custom cost how?

Don't have the code in front of me, but there is a conditional that if you consider a ref anf that ref is crowded (3 or more) then the cost is int.maxvalue (unreachable). We could change this to say that if there ref is crowded but there are no more uncrowded refs, then take it nonetheless.

I will take a look at the playtest (before the PF changes) to see what happened there, but my time for today is pretty much up, so that would be tomorrow.

Yeah that does sound better than the current condition.

The problem with that solution is that blockages will occur until that "stay behind" approach is implemented.

Take your time :)

Yes, but at least unlike now, it should only occur if you have a lot more harvesters than refineries, right? Not like the current 2 refs, 2 harvesters, and both are blocking each other at 1 of the refineries indefinitely, while the other one is empty. :D
And I do think idling on the battlefield is even worse.

Yeah it's an improbable situation. But your opinion (which I Agree), conflicts with the other comments in this thread. I'm not sure how to proceed. We should arrive to a consensus.

I'm a mere attendant :)

Not really. The other said that this PR fixes the current problem, which I confirm. But it may be introducing a more serious one :/
Can someone confirm please? I left pretty simple instructions on how to reproduce above.

@Rydra, I'd support this:

> We could change this to say that if there ref is crowded but there are no more uncrowded refs, then take it nonetheless.

It should cause blockage only if your harvesters are more than your refineries \* 3 or \* 4, so it should be fine for the moment. And that way harvesters won't idle in the middle of nowhere :)
As far as I've seen prior to my pathfinding merge, harvs were idle in the field till a ref was freed.

Yeah, I think it still happens on bleed if the harvester can't find a path to the refinery (it is completely blocked already). But now if the refinery is completely free, just reserved (by 3 harvesters that are far far away), the other harvesters still won't move.
I know there's no perfect solution here that will magically fix all problems, but I said which I think would be best for the moment and why. Once that is (if it is) done, I _may_ address the "behind the refinery" thing in my (eventually coming) docking fixing PR if that is out of your scope/interest.
If you want, you can wait for feedback from someone else.

Ok I futzed about on 50d726ea317f643fd35fd706d5dc9584d3073d8a (the commit before pathfinding changes were merged) to see what the behaviour was like then.
- The problem with harvesters pushing each other off the pad at a refinery is already present.
- Harvesters will idle in the field if refineries are full.

This PR fixes regressions introduced with the pathfinder merge and the other errors we've found were already present anyway.

Fixing the idling on the field and all the pushing would be great, I agree - but we should leave that for separate PRs in my opinion. Let's just get bleed into a playable state again first.
